result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas P White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, if not then perform 18 hours community service per week.

No contact with J.K.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed. and with prior authorization.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.
211 days credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

PLEA HEARING IN ALL FILES.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty.

$9,000.00 SIGNATURE WITH FIRST $1,000.00 CASH INCLUDES 14CM660 & 14CF304  No possession or consumption of alcohol. No drugs unless presribed. Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.   No contact with victim(s): J.K. & Lee's Piggly Wiggly. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
